intro: Ptilotus spicatus var. burbidgeanus, commonly known as the Burbidge's spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its wiry, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is well adapted to drought conditions and is often found in coastal and inland dunes.
